keywords.Comment:
Sets the flag for the efficient RIJCOSX algorithm 
(treat the Columb term via RI and the Exchange 
term via seminumerical integration)

Selects an integral direct calculation 
Selects an integral conventional calculation

Selects energy convergence check ans 
 sets ETol to 10^-n(n=6-10). Also selects 
appropiate thresh, tcut and bfcut values

Selects appropriate SCF convenger criteria 
for very difficult case
Selects a geometry optimization calculation(using internal redundant coordinates)
Optimization in Cartesian coordinates(if you ar desperate)
Selects an energy and gradient calculation
Numerical gradient(has explicitly to be asked for,if analytic gradieint is not available)
Use the latest(2016) atomic masses of the most abudant or most stable isotopes insted of atomic weigths
Turns on the use of molecular symmetry.THIS IS VERY RUDIMENTARY!

Correlation-cosistent basis sets: cc-pVDZ      - Dunning correlation-consistent polarized valence double-zeta
cc-pVTZ      - Dunning correlation-consistent polarized valence triple-zeta
cc-pVQZ      - Dunning correlation-consistent polarized valence quadruple-zeta
aug-cc-pVnZ  - (n= D,T,Q,5,6) Augmented with diffuse functions
aug-cc-pCVnZ - (n= D,T,Q,5,6) As above, augmented with diffuse functions
cc-pwCVnZ    - (n= D,T,Q,5) Core-polarized with weighted core functions
aug-cc-pwCVnZ- (n= D,T,Q,5) As above, augmented with diffuse functions
cc-pVn(+d)Z  -(n= D,T,Q,5) With tight d functions
SARC basis sets: Segmented all-electron relativistically contracted basis sets for use with the DKH2 and ZORA
Hamiltonians. Available for elements beyond Krypton.
Note: SARC/J is the general-purpose Coloumb-fitting auxiliary for all SARC orbital basis sets
Partially augmented correlation-consiste: apr-cc-pV(Q+d)Z  - Augumented with sp diffuse functions on Li-Ca
jun-cc-pV(n+d)Z  - (n=D,T,Q): sp(D), spd(T), spdf(Q) on Li-Ca
jul-cc-pV(n+d)Z  - (n=D,T,Q): spd(D), spdf(T), spdfg(Q) on Li-Ca
maug-cc-pV(n+d)Z - same as jun-, may-,and apr- for n- D, T, and Q, respectively
Auxiliary basis sets for simultaneously: Fitting basis sets developed by Weigend for fitting simultaneously Coulomb and exchanges energies
They are quite large anf accurate. They fit SCF energies very well but even it they are large they
do not fit correlation as well as the dedicated  /C auxilliary basis sets
Def/JK           - Coulomb + Exchange fitting for all def2 basis sets
Def/JKsmall      - reduced version of the above
cc-pVnZ/JK       - (n= T,Q,5) for the respective cc-pVnZ orbital basis
aug-cc-pVnZ/JK   -(n= T,Q,5) for the respective aug-cc-pVnZ orbital basis

Hybrid functionals.Comment: The one-parameter hybrid functional with Becke '88 exchange
The one-parameter hybrid version of BP86
The three-parameter hybrid version of BP86
The one-parameter hybrid version of  PW91

Range-separate hybrid functions.Comment: Head-Gordon's DF wB97X with minimal Fock exchange
Head-Gordon 's DF wB97X-V with VV10 nonlocal correlation
Modified version wB97X-V with D3BJ correction by Najibi and Goerigk
Modified version of wB97M-V with DFT-D4 correction by Najibi and Goerigk
range-separated PBE-based hybrid functional with 100% Fock exchange in the longe-range regiime

Local and gradient corrected functionals.Comment: Modified PW exchange and Pw correlation
Modified PW exchange and LYP correlation
PBE correlation with refitted Perdew '86 exchange

Dispersion corrections.Comment: density dependent atom-pairwise dispersion correction with Becke-Johson damping and ATM
Atom-pairwise dispersion correction to the DFT energy with Becke-Johson damping
Atom-pairwise dispersion correction with zero damping

Non-local correlation.Comment: Does a post-SCF correction on the energy only
Fully self-consistent approach, adding the VV10 correlation to the KS Hamiltonian
